subject: p16562430
History: Severe pulmonary fibrosis presenting with acute worsening shortness of breath.
Impression: AP chest compared to through : Comparing todays study with, the low lung volumes are unchanged but there is greater opacification throughout both lungs, most readily attributed to worsening pulmonary edema in the setting of pre-existing severe pulmonary fibrosis. Given the severity of the acute and chronic pulmonary abnormalities, concurrent pneumonia would be difficult to exclude radiographically but there is no asymmetry to suggest it. The heart is mildly enlarged, but generally obscured by adjacent parenchymal pulmonary abnormalities. There is no appreciable pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
